definition: expeditionary force/army on a distant expedition
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)
journey/trip/expedition/to go on long campaign/to attack

sentences.english: The ref FSV mainz give all brings the serious influence.
sentences.chinese: 遠征軍的大潰敗給一切人都帶來嚴重影響。

sentences.english: Our mission is to harass the landing of the main japanese expeditionary force .
sentences.chinese: 我們的任務是騷亂日本遠征軍主力的登陸。

sentences.english: When he was sixteen, he lied about his age to participate in the expedition.
sentences.chinese: 16歲時，他謊報年齡參加了遠征軍。

sentences.english: The Songshan Military Campaign between the Chinese Expeditionary Army and the Japanese Invaders in 1944 lasted three months and three days.
sentences.chinese: 遠征軍和日軍之間展開的松山戰役歷時三個月零三天。

sentences.english: One is marching across Europe and north America at this very moment.
sentences.chinese: 此時此刻一支克隆遠征軍正在跨越歐洲和北美大陸。

sentences.english: I tentatively decided, unless conditions should improve, to divert the expedition into Gibraltar.
sentences.chinese: 我臨時決定，除非情況轉佳，將遠征軍開向直布羅陀。

definition: Tai'erzhuang district of Zaozhuang city 棗莊市|枣庄市[Zao3 zhuang1 shi4], Shandong
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
Marco Polo Bridge Incident of 7th July 1937, regarded as the beginning of the Second Sino-Japanese War 抗日戰爭|抗日战争[Kang4 Ri4 Zhan4 zheng1]
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
War of Liberation (1945-49), after which the Communists 共產黨武裝|共产党武装 under Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 took over from the Nationalists 國民政府|国民政府 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
the Mukden or Manchurian Railway Incident of 18th September 1931 used by the Japanese as a pretext to annex Manchuria/also known as Liutiaogou incident 柳條溝事變|柳条沟事变
